node.title: IPCA rules police shooting of Waikato man justified
node.description: The police watchdog says officers who shot and killed a man who fired at them with a military-style rifle were justified in doing so.
node.content:
["The Independent Police Conduct Authority has found officers were justified in the fatal shooting of Hamilton man Joel Buckley.", "", "
File pic Photo: 123rf
", "Police were made aware of Buckley making threats in July last year.", "Five days later on 14 July, an attempt to arrest him at his home led to a confrontation and shots were fired by both parties.", "The authority said the police decision to shoot Buckley was to protect themselves and others and praised their courage and professionalism.", "It made four other findings in relation to what happened - including that officers failed to attend in a timely manner.", "It also found "significant failures" in decisions relating to Buckley's firearms licence.", "The police say Hamilton staff did not begin making inquiries in the expected timeframe, because the matter was initially incorrectly coded.", "Superintendent Richard Wilson said they did not act on information available about Buckley's suitability for firearms."]
